job_title: Memory Care Coordinator in Westerville, OH
pros: Getting to serve older adults everyday
cons: Very exhausting and consuming. No room for growth

job_title: Property Manager in New York, NY
pros: - Some higher level staff really care about you - Potential for free housing - Challenging work environment - Great mission - Great benefits
cons: - Poor supervision - Training protocols not followed - No work-life balance

job_title: Assistant Property Manager in Harper Woods, MI
pros: Work with nice people, lots of learning opportunities, clean and safe environment
cons: A lot of paperwork, must be good at multi tasking

pros: Nice residents cooks have no skills
cons: Place is run poorly and no one cares

pros: Working with clients and helping them meet their needs
cons: Only support staff on site to handle a large array of problems

pros: You are paid on time usually
cons: No communication. Poor leadership. Culture is very non supportive and non inclusive. Zero upward mobility. Not a friendly or advantageous place to work.

pros: Working with residents is very rewarding, helping people every day to obtain things like prescriptions, help with utility bills and transportation to medical appointments.
cons: Most of the residences are run with a skeleton-crew staff. The one I worked in had 72 units with a full-time property manager, a part-time service coordinator (me), part-time handyman and a part-time housekeeper, all low paying positions. It's not enough to properly care for all the residents. It might understandable, but the headquarters leadership are making extremely high salaries, (this is public information that can be found on the organization's 990 form). They could cut their salaries in half, still make a decent salary and put the rest toward helping the residents and improving the facilities.

review_title: There Will Always be Something to Learn and a Knew Problem to Solve
job_title: Service Coordinator in New Brunswick, NJ
pros: Decent wages (though they could be better), home/life balance, fun activities, getting to know the residents.
cons: Management can be lacking, you'll do far more than what the role says, troublesome residents can drain you and become a nuisance.

pros: Outstanding, mission minded employees and many middle management dedicated employees.
cons: Unable to strike a reasonable work/life balance. Senior management can, and they talk the talk but have a push it down mentality.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Columbus, OH
pros: Benifits and pay were good
cons: Staffing high turnover, lots of agency used

pros: You can work from home and very flexible schedule
cons: Working with managed care and MyCare OHio is a very confusing process. People who have worked in this position for years still don't quite know how it works, it seems to morph. Your main job is shopping and finding housing for challenging people with challenging records in a challenging housing environment for low income.

pros: Good hours and easy work. The managers are nice.
cons: Can be very busy at times with no staff.

review_title: Corporate deficiencies create chaos for the local level
job_title: Sales and Marketing in Alton, NH
pros: Fair pay and benefits are given to all employees
cons:
Chaos, micromanagement and miscommunication at the corporate level trickle down, resulting in frustration and apathy on the local level. Competent professionals are hired but not trusted or given the freedom to do their jobs without unnecessary and demoralizing involvement from conflicting departments in Columbus. Corporate operations, development and marketing do not communicate with each other which results in confusion on the local level. 
The company is trying to grow too fast, regularly acquiring additional properties while not addressing issues the communities they already have.

pros: Everyone is very kind and adequate training is provided.
cons: Pay increases are very minimum and hourly wages are not enough.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Waverly, OH
pros: Caring for my patients is always fulfilling.
cons: Caseloads too large and they do very little to minimize the geographic area you’ll be driving. They are always looking for ways to reduce your on call pay. Favoritism is rampant.

job_title: Quality Assurance Specialist in Columbus, OH
pros: Flexible and great team culture
cons: Lower pay and not much pto

pros: Friendly and structured management. Care about success.
cons: Lower salary, lots of responsibilities outside of job title

pros:
Gain knowledge in HUD/Tax-Credit compliance and regulations.
Build relationships throughout company and with senior housing tenants.
cons:
The pay and hours are not worth the effort put into the position.
The company doesn't recognize dedication and hard work of employees.
Annual raises are an insult to the employees and most older properties suffer with budgets and vacancies as no money is being put into updates of the communities.
 The companies big focus is on new, bigger buildings.

pros: No OT required, accrued PTO, suppertice immediate manager
cons: No growth, low pay and lack of support from corporate (from the attitudinal receptions/phone operator all the way to VP)

pros:
Great Mission and great people!
Well respected, very innovative

job_title: MSN, RN, Charge Nurse in Waverly, OH

cons: Occasional mandation, strict COVID protocol

review_title: A lot of work for little pay
job_title: Assistant Property Manager in Bedford, TX
pros: Positive atmosphere, company has taken good measures to help during Covid-19 with extra pay for a short period of time.
cons: A lot of work for minimum pay. Training is very vague and minimal.

job_title: Home Health Aide in East Columbus, OH
pros: Kind clients & Reimbursement of miles drove
cons: Non-consistent hours. Low pay. Far drives

pros:
Competitive Salary, good retirement plan and ability to match, good 
Vacation hours
Flexible schedule
cons: Communication of future plans and allowing time for pursuit of other avenues.

review_title: There are better jobs, especially if you have a college degree. Maybe a good entry level job
pros: This job is not overwhelming, it is typically pretty easy work. Flexible schedule, able to take time off easily when needed, and quiet office atmosphere. You get free merch often (with their logo on it), Xmas bonus, incentives during employee appreciation week. You do get a raise every year-ish...but it's not very much. You do get benefits, they are actually not very good (I mean at least you get them I guess). Able to work independently. Very stress free.
cons: #1 reason leaving was low pay. Didn't expect this job to pay much, but towards the end they were giving us tedious tasks not at all in my job description.  Not worth the low pay.  HR was really disappointing. Had some serious concerns involving residents and HR didn't really do anything. Pay scale wasn't fair. For some reason the property manager is your supervisor, yet they get paid less. Weird dynamics. You would be making the same amount as another SC who only worked one property with half the case load. They put you up at two properties and pay you for the price of one. Upper management were extremely unprofessional (it was shocking at times). The conferences every year were a  bust. They just seemed not authentic with trying to convey their "mission". The sole purpose of conference is just to make the company look good.

pros: Non-profit Home care and Hospice who truly lives out their mission statement.
cons: Training could be made better.

pros: flexible, overtime if you want it, great communication
cons: Lots of last minute changes (not due to company but to the nature of the industry)

pros: Pleasant clean environment and safe living for seniors
cons: I like the job, However it’s part time

job_title: Dietary Aide in Marble Cliff, OH
pros: The pay is pretty competitive for the industry
cons: Management can be difficult to work with

review_title: Voted Columbus' 2015 Best Places to Work for a reason
pros:
I have been thoroughly impressed with this organization and my co-workers from day 1 of joining here.  There are great people at all levels of the company and everyone is incredibly supportive of one another, almost to an "unheard of" level for a company.  This level of open arms and support normally is experienced within family and tight-knit small groups.  

It's also easy to feel great about working here knowing that you are part of such an important mission.  What I find amazing is that the leadership is actively striving to expand their services to help meet the needs of a growing concern: fulfilling the healthcare needs of an exponentially growing senior citizen population.  And I feel the sincerity in the mission.  It's the kind of company to work for that allows you to look at yourself in the mirror everyday and feel great about what you do for a living.

While it's roots are deep in Christian value, you do not have to be a Christian to work here.  All are welcomed.  This is most likely the most diverse company that I work for.  Every day I come to work to a positive environment. The company offers a great balance of life and work.  No one is just a number here.
cons: I have yet to discover any substantial enough to mention

job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant (STNA) in Hilliard, OH
pros: Friendly Management, Caring Atmosphere, Very Clean, Plenty of supplies to care for residents.
cons: Many shifts having to use agency help.

review_title: Checking back to the spokane reviews....after 3 years after termination 2014.
pros: Well you'll get 3 years of work. they will limit you to 30 hours....
cons:
So many ......first off they stole 2 weeks vacation and several days sick leave.
so my employment ran 3 years i replaced another guy who worked 3 years, He said he was dumbfounded at his firing...had no idea why they did this to him.
so guess what....every 3 years this company will toss you to the wolves.....and just hire another sole.
this includes managers/maintenance at the satellite sites but not in Ohio.

so i check back in 3 years its now late  2018......
Then i reviewed Indeed dot com. and glass door and find as of  June of 2017 the manager who fired me is Now gone.....(he left a nasty review of the company as well).

review_title: Great at first but.... Nurses Beware
job_title: Charge Nurse in Cuyahoga Falls, OH
pros:
If you are a new grad nurse then pay is terrible. If you have some experience then pay is not that bad. 
You qualify for a raise once a year, usually not much but still a raise. 
They have tuition assistance after one year of working. 
They offer 12 hr shifts. 
Pay double time on holidays.
cons:
Administration Administration Administration 
I have been there for many years and No one cares about you. They treat you like a walking pharmacy on wheels. Once you begin to talk and ask for help or point out things that need fixed you are automatically silenced or your need is passed about from boss to boss. They are always short staffed and many new nurses that come in leave before the end of there 90 days. Just beware and ask a lot of questions in your interview. It is not uncommon for one nurse to pass 60 residents pills. There is no help for the staff at all.

pros: National Church Residences has a good focus and mission. People seem to genuinely care about the work they do work. I especially liked the fact that they have open prayer once a month that is open to all employees.
cons: The training in the area I was in was not suitable for the time that I was expected to learn the job.  I feel like this company has a high turned over simply because they do not take the time needed to train the employees. The workload is so extensive that it takes at least 6 months to 1 year to actually feel comfortable in working in a position. ...Very heavy workload and poor supervision. I don't believe most of the HR staff are educated in their field so the company has  slow growth in company goals and high expectations in production. Manager relied on staff to manage new employees.

pros:
Great company to work for when all the stars align. The company offers perks (travel for seminars, benefits)
No micro managing which offers freedom to complete tasks and move on to other more pressing matters (I.e. Resident relations, etc.) Great opportunities to move up in the company (if you become a favorite and keep your RM supplied with gossip).
cons: The company has properties in several states but their headquarters is in Ohio. Because of this, they receive updates via phone (from typically one person). There is no "checks and balance" system. The lack of supervision opens the door for lower level managers to be unscrupulous (billing the company for hours they did not work, placing blame, taking advantage of residents, stealing petty cash, etc.).

pros: It's great to work somewhere that values its employees so highly - they pay competitively for the industry, they actively solicit feedback from employees on a regular basis, and they offer excellent work life balance.  This place is full of good people - my coworkers and boss are some of the nicest people I've met, and I know they have my back as I have theirs.  We work hard, and I feel appreciated for the time and effort I put in every day.  I've worked in other nonprofits, and this one by far has the best balance between carrying out the mission and running a solid business.  I feel proud to work here!
cons: Paid holidays are sparse, especially as compared to the rest of the nonprofit world.  Fast growth has created "growing pains" in several areas, but they are being actively worked through.

review_title: Dont let the name full you.
pros: The pros of being employed by National Church Residences is the mission that some actually believe in and strive for. Being able to go be someone a place to call home.
cons: It is all about who you know and making upper management look good. For an organization with such a name it is the most unchristian like organization there is. The employees out in the field do all the work and it's okay to be dishonest as long as it makes your Supervisor look good so they can get all the accolades. Lots of backstabbing and unfair treatment goes on while the upper management turns a blind eye to many things

pros: I am very fortunate to work in a department where I have been given the ability to grow within the organization and to take on additional responsibilities to further my career.  We have a great team and a great department head.  Overall, this  a good place to work.
cons: The internal communication could be better as could the internal customer service.  You would think everyone would want to help each other, but sadly, that isn't always the case.  The on-boarding process leaves a bit to be desired (when you are a new hire or promoted to a managerial level) - in many instances, you are just left to "figure it out".

review_title: National Church Residences - Legacy Village - Legacy Assisted Living Xenia, OH
pros: I am thankful I work for National Church Residences! I have good health insurance and benefits!  The CEO is always trying to improve our company for the seniors we serve and for us employees. The corp. executives in Columbus are helpful and friendly!  You call the Columbus office and they are there for you!! I LOVE working for Legacy Village in Xenia, OH! What a wonderful place! We employees become friends. Often become "like family".  We have the best residents anywhere! Easy to love on them! I am very thankful for my job at Legacy! God has blessed me!
cons: As with any place you work that never 'closes' sometimes you have to stay over your shift when a call off happens but the management is very reasonable and bends over backwards to accommodate us!

pros: Residents are nice and facility is clean. Located in a nice area. A lot of hours avail. Activities dept is good now i hear.
cons: Management is in it for the paycheck running a once beautiful facility into the ground. Every employee is very stressed over being overworked and understaffed and it shows. We once had a wonderful ft staff that had all been there for years. Most of them left. You had no time to give decent patient care. It was absolutely horrible. It should be illegal to run a facility under the staffing conditions. Management never does anything to improve conditions so people actually come to work. Work anywhere else.

review_title: Wonderful Place to work and serve our elderly and vulnerable population
job_title: First Community Village in Columbus, OH
pros: This is a wonderful place to work where I've had a great opportunity to help our community's elderly.  From the top down, I have found that decisions are made for our organization always with our mission at the top of mind.  I couldn't be prouder and more appreciative of the opporutnity I have to serve our residents on a daily basis.  We have recently received our new benefits package and one of the items I found to be very positive was the amount of choice each employee had in electing a plan that fit their individual needs.  It really showed the high level of priority our organization places on their team members.
cons: None - this is a GREAT organization!

review_title: Mission driven, high performing company with  excellent leadership.  Highly recommend
pros: National Church Residences is an outstanding organization!  From the Executive team to department leaders, all managers and employees I have come into contact with are professional and mission driven.  The organization is focused on the employees and they have made many significant changes within their benefits package in order to retain, engage and attract employees to the company.  My manager understands how important work life balance is and consistently makes this a priority.  My direct manager is always available, provides support and is an exceptional leader.  I cannot say enough positive things about this organization.
cons: Nothing.   Fortunate to work for National Church Residences.

review_title: Inconsistent management practices & terrible communication by team leaders
pros:
Flexibility for nurse case managers
Not intensely supervised 
Not accountable for daily whereabouts
Flexibility with creating schedules
cons:
On-call rotation tiring 
Lack of updates and not encouraged to update team members
Other disciplines (than nurses) not valued

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Upper Arlington, OH
pros: I have worked at the corporate office for almost 4 years, and I interact with the senior leadership daily. They are compassionate, driven people who genuinely care about the well-being of the company and its employees. They encourage staff to learn new skills and grow, and care about keeping talented people within the company.
cons: The salaries may not be competitive with other organizations. They're a non-profit group, so they care about the mission, not about the money. They are trying hard to take care of employees with salary and benefits, but they can only do so much working in affordable housing and depending on government funding.

pros: Nice residents with active resident council, attractive building, lots of online training opportunities.
cons: Property management problems, old office equipment, residents unhappy with property management & quality of maintenance

job_title: Communications & Marketing Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros:
Great benefits and upbeat, fun office atmosphere.
Everyone here is kind and helpful.
Sense of humbleness and pride knowing we really help people.
Our work is respected by management.
We honor God and each other.
Management is dedicated to helping us succeed to move to the next level.  They encourage and provide training to sharpen our current skills as well as learn new ones.  Very supportive and they say Thank You often.
cons: Our company is large therefore it will take several years to completely understand all the departments and services and how it all fits together.

review_title: High Stress Enviroment, No Management Support
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Cuyahoga Falls, OH
pros:
-Work 12 hr shifts, every other holiday
-Only work 3 days/week and every other weekend
-Offers free CEU's
-computer charting
cons:
-Low pay
-low raises
-promises that are broken
-management acts like they are out to get you.
-too many write ups for silly mistakes
-too many call offs
-to many madatory meetings

-crappy health insurance

pros: It's a great place to work we have amazing staff!!! That really care about the residents and the staff! We have amazing management!!! Our administrator and D.O.N are the best bosses you could ever work for..
cons: Anywhere your going to have your cons..I feel proud of where I work I don't see a lot of cons.. our pay is going up so that can't be a con any longer calls off they are getting better..staffing much better hiring is better..

job_title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant in Lake Wales, FL
pros: Management is nice, the residents are amazing. The residents are the only reason that I enjoyed my job. Provided great experience for my current job.
cons: The job has WAY too much responsibility for the little amount being paid. Corporate (National Church Residences) is all about slashing the budget but cares little about "low level" employees. And they are "Non-Profit." They would rather spend less and have high turnover than have quality employees. This is the reason I left.

pros: National Church Residences is focused on serving seniors better. Leadership has spearheaded an impressive number of corporate wide raises for front line staff the past few years. Competitive pay and benefits for the industry, with the bonus of being able to work at a mission oriented company.  They have an impressive "Mission Day" and "National Conference" to acknowledge employees and focus all employees on the importance of positively transforming the lives of seniors.  Leadership is encouraging, motivated and constantly looking to move forward with new ideas.
cons: A great place to work and improve the lives of seniors.

review_title: Seems to be a good job, until you actually start there
pros: Fair Pay, enjoyable residents to work with
cons: Office culture, Leadership expects you to do their offline work, like doing things for their daughter's athletic team and taking them places they want to go.  They will tell you to "love the residents, that is all they want" but when you start doing this, you will be told you are going beyond your job description.

review_title: Love the staff and residents.  Wish they paid better.
job_title: Service Coordinator in New Braunfels, TX
pros:
Most residents are happy to have a service coordinator
Small staff 
Very relaxed atmosphere
Great property manager 
Works with your schedule
cons:
Low salary
Performance goals difficult to achieve since service coordinator services are voluntary for residents

pros: It is good to work for a company that promotes from within and acknowledges good work performance. There are so many opportunities working for a growth company in a specialized field.  Good to be apart of this organization.
cons: Expectations are high and the pace is fast, not a good fit for everyone causing turn over in many areas.

review_title: I love this place. Truly great people.
pros: Mission oriented, great management, safe, secure working environment, and great place to acquire accounting experience. I enjoy working for a company that genuinely cares about people.
cons: Very reserved and shy culture (accounting department). There are many people that do the same job as me, so I sometimes feel very replaceable.

job_title: Property Manager in Bay City, TX
pros: The pay is pretty decent.
cons: Property Manager really had no say So to anything.

pros: National Church Residences is a great place to align purpose and mission with your work and daily tasks. I have worked for the organization for over a year, and I can truly say that the employees are genuinely motivated by serving God and serving seniors.
cons: The pace of work is faster and more complex than might be expected for a typical non-profit.

review_title: Solid company with a strong mission and core values with good intentions

Support from corporate

review_title: This is a results oriented company serving a well needed mission for elders.
pros: If you have an idea and it benefits the residents, employees and company, then you can implement the idea.
cons: As with all companies, it is sometimes difficult to get decisions made.

pros: Offer great training opportunities, and events for employees to take part in.  They also pay a very decent salary.
cons: If you don't work for them directly, but rather another management company, you miss out on alot of opportunities, and events that the company hosts, along with opportunities for advancement.

review_title: Management at Corporate Headquarters in the Healthcare division is a joke.
pros: You can get a paycheck here for a while until you can no longer stand the ridiculous management practices.
cons: There are senior managers who behave like Junior High school girls.  They enjoy the support and protection of the Human Resources department.  STEER CLEAR.  There are better places to work.  Even poverty is preferable to working here.

job_title: Service Coordinator in Ballston Spa, NY
pros: The wonderful people we work with. The Staff. The community support.

pros: My bosses are awesome!! The enthusiasm and efforts are above and beyond everyone works as a team to give out residences the best care possible.
cons: I don't have any complaints. Not many CNAs stay long

pros: I love the focus on the mission:  helping seniors.  It's got a not-for-profit heart, yet it is operated in a very professional manner.  This gives the organization the financial stability to stay in operation for decades to come.
cons: None  at this time, thanks.

job_title: Nurse Aide in Cuyahoga Falls, OH
pros: Great co-workers, the administrator really cares about his employees. Good pay for an aide.
cons: They keep things hush hush until after you get hired and then bomb you with bad news.

pros: My work is very demanding. I work with elders and people with disabilities. I enjoy being busy. I am able to correspond with many different people either in person or by phone or through email
cons: There is no room to grow as an employee.

job_title: Front Desk Clerk in Columbus, OH
pros: It is a paycheck for expenses
cons: Left hand doesn't know what the right hand is doing, favoritism, management hires illiterate college-grads, and to sum it all up messed up from infrastucture on out! Contingent workers get stuck working double shifts because if someone doesn't show or calls off, management doesn't come relieve you as per their job description!

pros: None.  I will never work for this company again.
cons: A complete lack of organization and leadership.  People are placed in impossible situations and then derided for performance.  Also a serious lack of any training.  Do not believe the hype,  it's all about the rent check.  If people, residents and employees, are taken care of, it only secondary to making money.

pros: Co-workers become family. Patients are the reason we come to work each day. Providing nursing and personal care, compassion and helping each day is more hopeful and brighter than the day before.
cons: Upper Management lack honesty. Understaffed most days.

job_title: Professional Cleaning Technician in Columbus, OH

pros: Good aides always smiling and willing to help therapists with their patients.

The lack of skill and knowledge of management is detrimental to the healing of patients.  The only "church" they worship is $$$$$.

pros: You get to help seniors and disabled individuals.
cons: Management will use you as a scapegoat.

pros: There was a lunch break.
cons: Horrible management and rude to all employees
